cmem_n_reasoning: Based on the report, 8 out of 10 examined lymph nodes demonstrated metastases. According to Rule 11, if the report specifies the number of positive lymph nodes with extracapsular extension, the N stage is N2 if 3 or more lymph nodes are positive. However, the report does not specify the presence or absence of extracapsular extension. Since the N1 stage requires 1-3 positive lymph nodes, and N3a and N3b require 4-9 or more than 9 positive lymph nodes respectively, the N2 stage is the most appropriate.

cmem_n_reasoning: Based on the report, one out of three sentinel lymph nodes (1/3) was found to have metastatic carcinoma, which indicates an N1 stage. The 'New Modified Rule 11' and 'New Rule N0' are applicable here. The 'New Rule N3a' and 'New Rule N3b' are not applicable since the number of positive lymph nodes is less than 4 and there is no mention of metastases in the infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes or ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes.
